title: Replace hidden admin trigger with visible footer tooth logo, consolidate admin dashboard, and confirm all UX/animation features

requirements.summary: Replace invisible bottom-right corner admin trigger with a visible small tooth SVG logo in the Footer that opens the HiddenAdminLoginModal on single click
acceptanceCriteria: A small tooth icon is visible at the bottom of the Footer on all pages.
Single-clicking the tooth icon opens the HiddenAdminLoginModal.
The modal accepts username '6352174912' and password '63521' and navigates to the admin dashboard on success.
The old invisible 50×50px bottom-right corner trigger (HiddenAdminTrigger component) is removed from App.tsx and no longer present in the DOM.
No other hidden admin triggers (triple-click footer copyright, 1×1px dot, logo long-press) exist anywhere in the site.

file_operations.description: Add a visible tooth logo icon at the bottom of the Footer component. The tooth logo must be the generated image at frontend/public/assets/generated/tooth-logo-footer.dim_48x48.png. Style it as a small (28-36px display size), semi-transparent but visible clickable element using teal/royal-blue accent colors. Attach an onClick handler that opens the HiddenAdminLoginModal (import and use state to control the modal visibility). Position the tooth icon centered or aligned at the very bottom of the footer layout. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Remove the HiddenAdminTrigger component import and its usage from the App layout. Ensure no invisible admin trigger element remains in the DOM. Confirm that the only admin access point is now the tooth logo in the Footer component.
Delete the HiddenAdminTrigger component file entirely as it is no longer needed after the tooth logo replaces it in the Footer.

requirements.summary: Consolidate Admin Dashboard to display appointments table with auto-refresh, clinic status toggle, and service manager CMS in a single accessible view
acceptanceCriteria: Admin Dashboard page shows all booked appointments in a table with Patient Name, Phone Number, Service, and Date/Time columns.
Appointments table auto-refreshes without page reload using React Query polling.
Clinic Status toggle (Open/Closed/Emergency) is present on the dashboard and updates the public-facing banner/modal in real time.
Service Manager CMS section is present on the dashboard (or accessible via a tab/link within the admin panel) with editable name, description, and photo upload for all 5 premium services.
Changes to service data persist in the backend and are reflected on the public service cards and detail pages.

file_operations.description: Consolidate the Admin Dashboard to display all three required admin capabilities in a single page view: (1) Appointments table with columns Patient Name, Phone Number, Service, Date/Time using the getAllAppointments query with refetchInterval set to 10 seconds or less for auto-refresh polling; (2) Clinic Status toggle (Open/Closed/Emergency) using the clinic status query and mutation to control the public-facing banner/modal; (3) Service Manager CMS section (or tabbed/linked navigation within the admin panel) allowing the admin to edit display name, description, and upload/replace the featured photo for each of the 5 premium services (Dental Implants, Invisalign, Pediatric Dentistry, Smile Makeover, Laser Dentistry). Ensure all sections are accessible from the dashboard without requiring separate page navigations. Use the authorization component to guard admin-only access. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Ensure the getAllAppointments query hook supports a refetchInterval option (≤10 seconds) to enable auto-refresh polling for the appointments table on the admin dashboard. Confirm the clinic status query and mutation hooks are available and properly configured to update the public-facing ClinicStatusBanner in real time. Verify all service-related query hooks support fetching and updating service data (name, description, photo) for the CMS section.

Ensure the ServiceManager component provides a form interface to edit display name, description, and upload/replace the featured photo for each of the 5 premium services. Use the blob-storage component to handle photo uploads with progress tracking. Confirm changes persist in the backend via the addOrUpdateService mutation and are immediately reflected on public-facing service cards and detail pages. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Audit and confirm the BookAppointmentDialog is fully frictionless with no Internet Identity login prompt, no auth check, and displays inline confirmation on success
acceptanceCriteria: BookAppointmentDialog opens directly without any login prompt on all public pages.
Form contains Patient Name and Phone Number fields as required minimum.
No auth-gated logic, disabled state, or Internet Identity prompt exists anywhere in the booking flow.
On form submission, inline confirmation message appears inside the dialog.
All 'Book Appointment' / 'Book Now' buttons on Home, HeroSection, and all 5 service detail pages open the frictionless dialog directly.

file_operations.description: Audit the BookAppointmentDialog component to ensure it is fully frictionless: remove any Internet Identity login prompt, auth check, or disabled state tied to authentication. Confirm the form contains at minimum Patient Name (text input) and Phone Number (tel input) fields. Service (dropdown) and Preferred Date (date picker) fields may remain if already present. On successful submission, display an inline confirmation message inside the dialog: 'Thank You! Your appointment has been booked. We will contact you shortly.' Do not redirect the user. Ensure the bookAppointment backend capability is called without any authentication requirement.

Confirm all 'Book Appointment' or 'Book Now' buttons on the Home page (including those in the HeroSection component) open the BookAppointmentDialog directly without any authentication step. Verify no login prompt or auth check is triggered before the dialog opens.

Confirm the 'Book Appointment' or 'Book Now' button on the DentalImplantsDetail page opens the BookAppointmentDialog directly without any authentication step. Verify no login prompt or auth check is triggered before the dialog opens.

Confirm the 'Book Appointment' or 'Book Now' button on the InvisalignDetail page opens the BookAppointmentDialog directly without any authentication step. Verify no login prompt or auth check is triggered before the dialog opens.

Confirm the 'Book Appointment' or 'Book Now' button on the LaserDentistryDetail page opens the BookAppointmentDialog directly without any authentication step. Verify no login prompt or auth check is triggered before the dialog opens.

Confirm the 'Book Appointment' or 'Book Now' button on the PediatricDentistryDetail page opens the BookAppointmentDialog directly without any authentication step. Verify no login prompt or auth check is triggered before the dialog opens.

Confirm the 'Book Appointment' or 'Book Now' button on the SmileMakeoverDetail page opens the BookAppointmentDialog directly without any authentication step. Verify no login prompt or auth check is triggered before the dialog opens.

Confirm the 'Book Appointment' or 'Book Now' button in the HeroSection component opens the BookAppointmentDialog directly without any authentication step. Verify no login prompt or auth check is triggered before the dialog opens.

requirements.summary: Confirm the 'XYZ Dental Clinic' brand name in the Header triggers window.location.reload() on click with no router navigation and unchanged visual styling
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking the 'XYZ Dental Clinic' brand name in the Header causes a full page reload.
No router Link or navigation event fires on brand name click.
Brand name visual appearance (color, font, weight) is unchanged.

file_operations.description: Ensure the 'XYZ Dental Clinic' brand name element in the Header triggers window.location.reload() on click. Remove any router Link or navigation event handler from the brand name element and replace it with an onClick handler that calls window.location.reload(). Confirm the visual styling of the brand name (color, font, weight) remains unchanged and no underline appears on hover.

requirements.summary: Confirm the custom cursor follower (circle, trail, 'View' text expansion) is fully removed from the site and the browser's native OS cursor is active
acceptanceCriteria: No cursor circle, trail, or 'View' text element appears anywhere on the site.
Body and html elements do not have cursor: none applied.
The browser's default system cursor is visible and functional across all pages.

file_operations.description: Confirm the CustomCursor component is empty or disabled and does not render any cursor follower elements (circle, trail, 'View' text). If the component still contains any active logic, remove it entirely or ensure it returns null.
Confirm the CursorContext file is empty or does not inject any cursor overrides into the application. If any context provider or cursor logic remains, remove it entirely or ensure it does nothing.
Confirm the App.tsx file does not import or render the CustomCursor component or CursorContext provider. If any references remain, remove them entirely.

Audit the global CSS file to ensure no CSS rule sets cursor: none on body or html elements. Remove any such rule if present. Confirm the browser's native OS cursor is active and visible across the entire site.

requirements.summary: Confirm and enforce the animated mesh gradient background throughout the entire site with a 15-20 second continuous CSS animation loop
acceptanceCriteria: A slow-moving mesh gradient background is visible on all pages (home, detail pages, and admin pages).
The gradient cycles through light white, pale silver, and soft blue shades continuously.
The animation loop duration is between 15 and 20 seconds.
The background does not obscure any text or interactive elements.

file_operations.description: Confirm the animated mesh gradient background is defined in the global CSS and applied to the body or html element. The gradient must shift subtly between very light white, pale silver, and soft blue shades over a 15-20 second continuous CSS animation loop. Ensure the background is applied at the root layout level so it appears behind all page content on every page (home, detail pages, admin pages) without obscuring text or interactive elements.
Confirm the App.tsx root layout does not override or block the global animated mesh gradient background. Ensure all child pages and components inherit the background from the root layout.

Animations are present on ServicesGrid, DoctorProfile, TestimonialCarousel, BeforeAfterSlider, ContactSection, and service detail page sections.

file_operations.description: Confirm the useScrollReveal hook uses IntersectionObserver to toggle an isVisible flag once an element enters the viewport. requirements.summary: Confirm the interactive Before/After drag slider (BeforeAfterSlider component) is prominently displayed in a dedicated 'Results Gallery' section on the Home page
acceptanceCriteria: A Before/After slider is present and visible in a results/gallery section on the Home page.
Users can click-drag and touch-drag the divider handle to reveal before and after images.
The slider uses backend data if available, or falls back to static dental treatment image pairs.
The section is labeled (e.g., 'Treatment Results' or 'Before & After').

file_operations.description: Confirm the BeforeAfterSlider component is included in a dedicated 'Results Gallery' or 'Before & After' section on the Home page. The section must be prominently displayed without requiring too much scrolling and be clearly labeled. Ensure the slider component is properly wired into the Home page layout.

Confirm the BeforeAfterSlider component supports mouse drag and touch drag to reveal before (left) and after (right) dental treatment images. Use backend-stored before/after pairs via the getAllBeforeAfterPairs query if available, otherwise fall back to static example image pairs. Ensure the component is interactive and functional.

requirements.summary: Confirm and enforce the soft glow hover effect on all 5 premium service cards in the ServicesGrid with lift and box-shadow glow
acceptanceCriteria: All 5 premium service cards lift upward (translateY negative) on hover.
All 5 premium service cards emit a teal or royal-blue box-shadow glow on hover.
Hover transition is smooth (~300ms) both on enter and exit.
Existing card-specific animations (3D rotation on Dental Implants, scan line on Laser Dentistry, etc.) remain functional alongside the glow/lift effect.

file_operations.description: Confirm and enforce the soft glow hover effect on all 5 premium service cards (Dental Implants, Invisalign, Pediatric Dentistry, Smile Makeover, Laser Dentistry). On mouse hover, each card must lift slightly (translateY(-6px) to -8px) and emit a gentle box-shadow glow using the site's teal or royal-blue accent color. The lift and glow must transition smoothly in and out with a CSS transition of approximately 300ms. Ensure this effect coexists with each card's existing specific animation (3D rotation, scan line, etc.).

Confirm the Tailwind configuration includes custom glow box-shadow utilities using the site's teal or royal-blue accent colors. Ensure the glow utilities are available for use in the ServicesGrid component hover effects.
